titleStmt.title: To EMMA PENDER,Emma Pender (1816-90) n√©e Denison, second wife of Sir John Pender (1816-96), Scottish textile merchant in Manchester, submarine communications cable pioneer, and politician, who organised work experience positions for CD's son Alfred (1845-1912) in the textile trade. See To Frederick Lehmann, Pilgrim Letters 10, p. 217. 5 MAY 1863
titleStmt.bibl: Charles Dickens Letters Project, ed. Leon Litvack, Katie Brandt, Emily Bell, and Jeremy Parrott (London: Dickens Fellowship), DickensLetters.com.

address.addrLine: Mrs Pender | 9 Park Street | Westminster | S.W.

dateline.placeName:
GAD'S HILL PLACE
HIGHAM BY ROCHESTER, KENT

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens very much regrets that as he is announced to read on Friday the Fifteenth,CD read Little Dombey and The Trial from Pickwick in Hanover Square Rooms, London, on 15 May 1863. he cannot have the honor of dining with Mr and Mrs Pender on that day.
